required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Deep vs Moderate Neuromuscular Blocks on Remifentanil for Laparoscopic Gastrectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Deep Versus Moderate Neuromuscular Blocks on Remifentanil Requirements in Patients Undergoing Surgical Pleth Index-guided Analgesia for Laparoscopic Gastrectomy

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose is to compare the remifentanil requirements in deep vs moderate neuromuscular blocks during the surgical pleth index -guided anesthesia in patients undergoing laparoscopic gastrectomy.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: from pneumoperitoneum to removal of laparoscope
primary_outcome.description: remifentanil infusion using target effect-site concentration to achieve an surgical pleth index of range between 20 and 50

arm_group.description: maintaining of moderate neuromuscular block (train-of-four count 1-2) during surgery, reversal using neostigmine 50 ug/kg and glycopyrrolate 10 ug/kg
maintaining of deep neuromuscular block (posttetanic count 1-2) during surgery, reversal using sugammadex 2~4 mg/kg

intervention.description: maintaining of moderate neuromuscular block (train-of-four count 1-2) during surgery, reversal using neostigmine 50 ug/kg and glycopyrrolate 10 ug/kg
maintaining of deep neuromuscular block (posttetanic count 1-2) during surgery, reversal using sugammadex 2-4 mg/kg

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of gastric cancer Scheduled laparoscopic gastrectomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients refusal to consent Hyperbilirubinemia Chronic pain Opioid abuse Incurrent infective status Peripheral vascular disease

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine, Ajou University School of Medicine
